info.title: Desktop Virtualization API Client
info.description: This Typespec represents the Desktop Virtualization API interfaces.

AgentUpdatePatchProperties.description: The session host configuration for updating agent, monitoring agent, and stack component.

type.description: The type of maintenance for session host components.

useSessionHostLocalTime.description: Whether to use localTime of the virtual machine.

maintenanceWindowTimeZone.description: Time zone for maintenance as defined in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.timezoneinfo.findsystemtimezonebyid?view=net-5.0. Must be set if useLocalTime is true.

maintenanceWindows.description: List of maintenance windows. Maintenance windows are 2 hours long.

FailHealthCheckOnStagingFailure.description: Parameter indicating how the health check should behave if this package fails staging

values.name: Unhealthy
values.description: Health Check will report unhealthy

values.name: NeedsAssistance
values.description: Health Check will report NeedsAssistance

values.name: DoNotFail
values.description: Health Check will not report failure

HealthCheckName.description: Represents the name of the health check operation performed.

values.name: DomainJoinedCheck
values.description: Verifies the SessionHost is joined to a domain. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the SessionHost is not joined to the domain. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: DomainTrustCheck
values.description: Verifies the SessionHost is not experiencing domain trust issues that will prevent authentication on SessionHost at connection time when session is created. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if we cannot reach the domain for authentication on the SessionHost. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: FSLogixHealthCheck
values.description: Verifies the FSLogix service is up and running to make sure users' profiles are loaded in the session. If this check fails is classified as fatal as even if the connection can succeed, user experience is bad as the user profile cannot be loaded and user will get a temporary profile in the session. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: SxSStackListenerCheck
values.description: Verifies that the SxS stack is up and running so connections can succeed. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the SxS stack is not ready. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: UrlsAccessibleCheck
values.description: Verifies that the required WVD service and Geneva URLs are reachable from the SessionHost. These URLs are: RdTokenUri, RdBrokerURI, RdDiagnosticsUri and storage blob URLs for agent monitoring (geneva). If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be that monitoring agent is unable to store warm path data (logs, operations ...). (Currently Disabled)

values.name: MonitoringAgentCheck
values.description: Verifies that the required Geneva agent is running. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be that monitoring agent is missing or running (possibly) older version. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: DomainReachable
values.description: Verifies the domain the SessionHost is joined to is still reachable. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the domain the SessionHost is joined is not reachable at the time of connection. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: WebRTCRedirectorCheck
values.description: Verifies whether the WebRTCRedirector component is healthy. The WebRTCRedirector component is used to optimize video and audio performance in Microsoft Teams. This checks whether the component is still running, and whether there is a higher version available. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be the WebRTCRedirector component has to be restarted or updated. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: SupportedEncryptionCheck
values.description: Verifies the value of SecurityLayer registration key. If the value is 0 (SecurityLayer.RDP) this check fails with Error code = NativeMethodErrorCode.E_FAIL and is fatal. If the value is 1 (SecurityLayer.Negotiate) this check fails with Error code = NativeMethodErrorCode.ERROR_SUCCESS and is non fatal. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: MetaDataServiceCheck
values.description: Verifies the metadata service is accessible and return compute properties. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: AppAttachHealthCheck
values.description: Verifies that the AppAttachService is healthy (there were no issues during package staging). The AppAttachService is used to enable the staging/registration (and eventual deregistration/destaging) of MSIX apps that have been set up by the tenant admin. This checks whether the component had any failures during package staging. Failures in staging will prevent some MSIX apps from working properly for the end user. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be certain apps will not work for end-users. (Currently Enabled)

HealthCheckResult.description: Represents the Health state of the health check we performed.

values.name: Unknown
values.description: Health check result is not currently known.

values.name: HealthCheckSucceeded
values.description: Health check passed.

values.name: HealthCheckFailed
values.description: Health check failed.

values.name: SessionHostShutdown
values.description: We received a Shutdown notification.

value.description: The HostPool items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

HostPoolPatch.description: HostPool properties that can be patched.

properties.description: HostPool properties that can be patched.

maxSessionLimit.description: The max session limit of HostPool.

loadBalancerType.description: The type of the load balancer.

vmTemplate.description: VM template for sessionhosts configuration within hostpool.

ssoadfsAuthority.description: URL to customer ADFS server for signing WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientId.description: ClientId for the registered Relying Party used to issue WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientSecretKeyVaultPath.description: Path to Azure KeyVault storing the secret used for communication to ADFS.

ssoSecretType.description: The type of single sign on Secret Type.

preferredAppGroupType.description: The type of preferred application group type, default to Desktop Application Group

startVMOnConnect.description: The flag to turn on/off StartVMOnConnect feature.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Enabled to allow this resource to be access from the public network

agentUpdate.description: The session host configuration for updating agent, monitoring agent, and stack component.

managedPrivateUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

directUDP.description: Default: AVD-wide settings are used to determine connection availability, Enabled: UDP will attempt this connection type when making connections. This means that this connection is possible, but is not guaranteed, as there are other factors that may prevent this connection type, Disabled: UDP will not attempt this connection type when making connections

values.name: Personal
values.description: Users will be assigned a SessionHost either by administrators (PersonalDesktopAssignmentType = Direct) or upon connecting to the pool (PersonalDesktopAssignmentType = Automatic). They will always be redirected to their assigned SessionHost.

values.name: Pooled
values.description: Users get a new (random) SessionHost every time it connects to the HostPool.

values.name: BYODesktop
values.description: Users assign their own machines, load balancing logic remains the same as Personal. PersonalDesktopAssignmentType must be Direct.

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

ScalingPlanPersonalSchedulePatch.description: ScalingPlanPersonalSchedule properties that can be patched.

daysOfWeek.description: Set of days of the week on which this schedule is active.

rampUpStartTime.description: Starting time for ramp up period.

rampUpAutoStartHosts.description: The desired startup behavior during the ramp up period for personal vms in the hostpool.

rampUpStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the ramp up phase. If this is disabled, session hosts must be turned on using rampUpAutoStartHosts or by turning them on manually.

rampUpActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the ramp up period.

rampUpMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the ramp up period.

rampUpActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the ramp up period.

rampUpMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the ramp up period.

peakStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the peak phase.

peakActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the peak period.

peakMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the peak period.

peakActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the peak period.

peakMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the peak period.

rampDownStartTime.description: Starting time for ramp down period.

rampDownStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the ramp down phase.

rampDownActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the ramp down period.

rampDownMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the ramp down period.

rampDownActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the ramp down period.

rampDownMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the ramp down period.

offPeakStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the off-peak phase.

offPeakActionOnDisconnect.description: Action to be taken after a user disconnect during the off-peak period.

offPeakMinutesToWaitOnDisconnect.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user disconnects during the off-peak period.

offPeakActionOnLogoff.description: Action to be taken after a logoff during the off-peak period.

offPeakMinutesToWaitOnLogoff.description: The time in minutes to wait before performing the desired session handling action when a user logs off during the off-peak period.

values.description: Session is active

SetStartVMOnConnect.description: The desired configuration of Start VM On Connect for the hostpool during the ramp up phase. If this is disabled, session hosts must be turned on using rampUpAutoStartHosts or by turning them on manually.

values.name: Enable
values.description: Start VM on Connect is enabled

value.description: The StartMenuItem items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

filePath.description: Path to the file of StartMenuItem.

StartupBehavior.description: The desired startup behavior during the ramp up period for personal vms in the hostpool.

values.name: None
values.description: Session hosts will not be started by the service. This setting depends on Start VM on Connect to be enabled to start the session hosts.

values.name: WithAssignedUser
values.description: Session hosts with an assigned user will be started during Ramp Up

values.name: All
values.description: All personal session hosts in the hostpool will be started during ramp up.

values.name: Available
values.description: Session Host has passed all the health checks and is available to handle connections.

values.name: Unavailable
values.description: Session Host is either turned off or has failed critical health checks which is causing service not to be able to route connections to this session host. Note this replaces previous 'NoHeartBeat' status.

values.name: Shutdown
values.description: Session Host is shutdown - RD Agent reported session host to be stopped or deallocated.

values.name: Disconnected
values.description: The Session Host is unavailable because it is currently disconnected.

values.name: Upgrading
values.description: Session Host is unavailable because currently an upgrade of RDAgent/side-by-side stack is in progress. Note: this state will be removed once the upgrade completes and the host is able to accept connections.

values.name: UpgradeFailed
values.description: Session Host is unavailable because the critical component upgrade (agent, side-by-side stack, etc.) failed.

values.name: NoHeartbeat
values.description: The Session Host is not heart beating.

values.name: NotJoinedToDomain
values.description: SessionHost is not joined to domain.

values.name: DomainTrustRelationshipLost
values.description: SessionHost's domain trust relationship lost

values.name: SxSStackListenerNotReady
values.description: SxS stack installed on the SessionHost is not ready to receive connections.

values.name: FSLogixNotHealthy
values.description: FSLogix is in an unhealthy state on the session host.

values.name: NeedsAssistance
values.description: New status to inform admins that the health on their endpoint needs to be fixed. The connections might not fail, as these issues are not fatal.

StopHostsWhen.description: Specifies when to stop hosts during ramp down period.

values.name: ZeroSessions
values.description: Zero Total Sessions

values.name: ZeroActiveSessions
values.description: Zero Active Sessions

Time.description: The time for a scaling action to occur.

values.name: Initial
values.description: Update is initializing

values.name: Pending
values.description: Update is pending

values.name: Started
values.description: Update has started

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Update has succeeded

values.name: Failed
values.description: Update has failed
